title: Solubility CH3OH in H2O from IMFs

content.question: Methanol, <math alttext="C H 3 O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, dissolves completely in water to form a solution that does not conduct electricity. Which of the following diagrams best shows the major type of attractive force that exists between the particles in the solution?

choices.label: The diagram presents the structure of two molecules. The first molecule has a C atom connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The C atom is also connected to an O atom by a single bond. The O atom has three nonbonding pairs of electrons and a negative one charge.  The second molecule has an O atom connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The O atom has one nonbonding pair of electrons. One H atom has a positive one charge. The two molecules are oriented so that the bond between C and the O atom with a negative one charge is in line with the bond between the H atom with a positive charge and the O atom in the second molecule. There is a dashed line connecting the O atom with negative one charge and the H atom with a positive one charge.

The diagram presents the structures of two molecules. The first molecule has a C atom connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The C atom is also connected to an O atom by a single bond. The O atom has three nonbonding pairs of electrons and a negative one charge.  The second molecule has an O atom connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The O atom has one nonbonding pair of electrons. One H atom has a positive one charge. The two molecules are oriented so that the bond between C and the O atom with a negative one charge is in line with the bond between the O atom with the nonbonding pair of electrons and H atom with a positive charge in the second molecule. There is a dashed line connecting the O atom with negative one charge and the O atom with the nonbonding pair of electrons.

The diagram presents the structures of two molecules. The first molecule has a C atom connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The C atom is also connected to an O atom by a single bond. The O atom has two nonbonding pairs of electrons.  The second molecule has an O atom with two nonbonding pairs of electrons connected to two H atoms by single bonds.  The two molecules are oriented so that the leftmost H of the second molecule is connected to the O of the first molecule by a dashed line.

The diagram presents the structures of two molecules. The first molecule has a C atom connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The C atom is also connected to an O atom by a single bond. The O atom has two nonbonding pairs of electrons and is connected to an H atom by a single bond.  The second molecule has an O atom connected to two H atoms by single bonds. The O atom has two nonbonding pairs of electrons. The two molecules are oriented so that the O atoms are near one another and connected by a dashed line.

content.answer: The diagram presents the structures of two molecules. The first molecule has a C atom connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The C atom is also connected to an O atom by a single bond. The O atom has two nonbonding pairs of electrons.  The second molecule has an O atom with two nonbonding pairs of electrons connected to two H atoms by single bonds.  The two molecules are oriented so that the leftmost H of the second molecule is connected to the O of the first molecule by a dashed line.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
